summary: The Occupational Therapy Mental Health Parity Act (H.R. 4037) aims to clarify Medicare coverage for occupational therapy services related to substance use and mental health disorders. The bill mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to provide education and outreach to stakeholders within one year of the Act's enactment, focusing on the Medicare Benefit Policy Manual and the use of applicable Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) codes. The bill was introduced on June 17, 2025.
